org.intellimate.izou.sdk.frameworks.music.player.template

Class Player<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.intellimate.izou.sdk.util.AddOnModule
      • org.intellimate.izou.sdk.output.OutputPluginArgument<Object,T>
        • org.intellimate.izou.sdk.output.OutputPlugin<T>
          • org.intellimate.izou.sdk.frameworks.music.player.template.Player<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, org.intellimate.izou.events.EventListenerModel, org.intellimate.izou.identification.Identifiable, org.intellimate.izou.output.OutputPluginModel<Object,T>, org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceBuilderModel, MusicHelper, MusicProvider, PermanentSoundHelper, PermanentSoundUsed, ContextProvider, FireEvent, Loggable, LoggedExceptionCallback, ThreadPoolUser, org.intellimate.izou.threadpool.ExceptionCallback

    public abstract class Player<T>
extends OutputPlugin<T>
implements MusicProvider, org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceBuilderModel, MusicHelper, org.intellimate.izou.events.EventListenerModel
    use this class to actually play music.

    How to use it:
    Usage is pretty straightforward. Extend this class an override the abstract methods. To register further commands, use the getCommandHandler() method in the constructor. to start playing, use the PlayerController.startPlaying() methods, never call the play() method directly!. Also, don't call the stopSound() method directly!. All basic methods are implemented in this class,but to code special behaviour fell free to explore the other classes and interfaces.
    Note: the playback automatically stops when the user left.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    LeanderK

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(Context context,
              String id,
              boolean runsInPlay,
              List<org.intellimate.izou.identification.Identifiable> activators,
              boolean providesTrackInfo,
              boolean playbackShuffle,
              boolean playbackRepeat,
              boolean playbackRepeatSong,
              boolean isUsingJava)
        creates a new output-plugin with a new id
        Parameters:
        context - context
        id - the id of the new output-plugin. The ID of the InformationProvider is also based on this id (id + ".InformationProvider")
        runsInPlay - whether the termination of the play method should be treated as the termination the music (STOP not PAUSE)
        activators - the activators which are able to start the Player if the Player is not able to start from request from other addons
        providesTrackInfo - whether the Player provides TrackInfo
        playbackShuffle - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is shuffling
        playbackRepeat - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is repeating
        playbackRepeatSong - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is repeating the song
        isUsingJava - true if using java, false if not (and for example a C-library)

      • Player

        activator - the activator which is able to start the Player if the Player is not able to start from request from other addons
        providesTrackInfo - whether the Player provides TrackInfo
        playbackShuffle - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is shuffling
        playbackRepeat - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is repeating
        playbackRepeatSong - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is repeating the song

        Parameters:
        context - context
        id - the id of the new output-plugin
        runsInPlay - whether the termination of the play method should be treated as the termination of playing the music
        playRequestTrackInfo - whether the player is able to process PlayRequests with TrackInfo
        providesTrackInfo - whether the Player provides TrackInfo
        playbackShuffle - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is shuffling
        playbackRepeat - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is repeating
        playbackRepeatSong - whether the player is able to provide the info that the playback is repeating the song
        isUsingJava - true if using java, false if not (and for example a C-library)

      • updateCurrentTrackInfo

        public void updateCurrentTrackInfo(TrackInfo trackInfo)
        checks if the trackInfo is an update and fires the appropriate Event. This method should not be called without an active playlist, or an NullPointerException will be thrown. this method:
        - fires nothing if the trackInfo equals the current trackInfo.
        - fires an trackInfoUpdate if the trackInfo contains information not found in the current.

      • trackInfoUpdate

        public void trackInfoUpdate(Playlist playlist,
                            TrackInfo info)
        call this method if the trackInfo object in the playlist was updated. Only the trackinfo object will be sent via Event
        Parameters:
        playlist - the playlist
        info - the new trackInfo object

      • announceResources

        public List<? extends org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceModel> announceResources()
        This method is called to register what resources the object provides. just pass a List of Resources without Data in it.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        a List containing the resources the object provides

      • announceEvents

        public List<? extends org.intellimate.izou.events.EventModel<?>> announceEvents()
        this method is called to register for what Events it wants to provide Resources.

        The Event has to be in the following format: It should contain only one Descriptor and and one Resource with the ID "description", which contains an description of the Event.

        Specified by:
        announceEvents in interface org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceBuilderModel
        Returns:
        a List containing ID's for the Events

      • provideResource

        public List<org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceModel> provideResource(List<? extends org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceModel> resources,
                                                                         Optional<org.intellimate.izou.events.EventModel> event)
        This method is called when an object wants to get a Resource.

        Don't use the Resources provided as arguments, they are just the requests. There is a timeout after 1 second.

        Specified by:
        provideResource in interface org.intellimate.izou.resource.ResourceBuilderModel
        Parameters:
        resources - a list of resources without data
        event - if an event caused the action, it gets passed. It can also be null.
        Returns:
        a list of resources with data

        Parameters:
